summary: You Belong With Me (3) Paring: Steve Rogers x Reader, Bucky Barnes x Reader  Summary: Your hopeless crush Steve turns to dust...
body:
You Belong With Me (3)

Paring: Steve Rogers x Reader, Bucky Barnes x Reader

Summary: Your hopeless crush Steve turns to dust when he talks about your best friend Sharon. Or does it?

Warnings: language, angst, another cliffhanger.

Word count: 545

A/n: Short chapter cause i’m not giving in that easily, you are going to have to wait. I will link the previous 2 parts soon but i’m on my mobile and the same with updating my masterlist.

Part 1, Part 2, Part 3

Steve and Bucky wasted no time in running out the building to you but each of them were thinking the worst. Clint called through the coms saying that he’s got all the intel but the boys just couldn’t find words so when Clint made it out to them he was just as shocked. It wasn’t like you to go down on a mission which is just what was shocking about it.

Bucky scooped you up bridal style and carried you to the quinjet, he was too afraid to check for a pulse, he didn’t want to know if you were actually gone he wouldn’t be able to handle it let along telling Steve the news. It would break their hearts. Clint hooked you up with some stuff they had on the jet in case things got a little rough and they all didn’t say a word the rest of the flight. Clint had alerted the team already about your current state and the team have a room waiting for you in med bay.

Steve Carried you to the med bay as quick as he could and left you in the care of the doctors and nurses there. The whole team waited in the waiting area for what felt like forever, no one spoke, no one came to tell them any news and when Tony would ask passing doctors and nurses they wouldn’t give any information about your current status.

2 hours passed slowly since you were brought to med bay and the room was tense you could feel it from miles away. Steve and Tony paced back and forth, Nat, Wanda and Clint had their heads in their hands, Pietro had passed out on 4 of the seats, Bucky, Sam and Bruce were sitting tapping their feet and shuffling in their seats impatiently and uncomfortably while Thor and Vision where standing beside the window.

5 hours passed and still no word about you and everyone hadn’t moved much from their positions before. Bucky sighed heavily, moving his head in his hands then running them down his face. Nat got up and moved beside him placing s hand on his knee.

“Hey, she’ll be okay, Y/n has never failed a mission and she this isn’t going to be her first nor her last.” She tapped his leg then moved back to her seat.

Bucky got up and left to go get him some coffee just to keep him up. Steve followed close behind.

“You know, this is kinda stupid.” Steve breathed a slight laugh and shook his head. “We are fighting over a some girl who we both care about and now she’s in a hospital bed and we’re out here freaking the fuck out.” Bucky couldn’t stop the laugh that escaped his mouth about Steve swearing.

“You’re right Pal but we’ll talk about this when we know that she’s going to be okay, and she isn’t just some girl.” Bucky paused.

“She’s amazing, strong and perfect in everyway.” Steve finished and Bucky nodded in agreement. Steve and Bucky were friends again and now they were just waiting for you, they have no idea what they are going to do when you wake up but they are willing to wait till you wake up.

Hopefully.

Tags

@faakelanadelrey @alexfayer @skeletoresinthebasement @fangirl-with-a-mission @bucky-to-my-barnes

Steve Rogers

@patzammit

summary: I’m still mad that they deleted Loki’s ‘Coronation’-scene because that makes it canon that Loki zones out into their own...
body:
I’m still mad that they deleted Loki’s ‘Coronation’-scene because that makes it canon that Loki zones out into their own illusions when they don’t want to deal with shit. How often did Emo Child Odinsbarn do that in their youth when they weren’t as good at it yet? 

How often is someome telling them about some of Thor’s jock activities and Loki just goes to their mental Frozen Yoghurt where they’re always first in line? 

I bet Thor already knows the signs and they’re talking to some boring advisor who’s walking with them through some corridor and Thor instantly realises that Loki’s eyes have been glazed over for twenty minutes now and they haven’t spoken a word since they switched to the “Jason Momoa giving me a deep tissue massage”-channel and without looking away from the advisor, Thor grabs Loki’s wrist and steers them through a door before they can run into a wall. Except sometimes he doesn’t notice that his sibling switched to auto-pilot and they go hunting and Fandral’s moustache gets stuck in a bush or something and everyone stops except Loki who didn’t notice because they’re being coronated for the third time this week (this time wearing the snake torque though, which is something else entirely) so they just keep walking and by the time the others saved Fandral or whatever they notice that Loki’s disappeared. Or stuck in a bush too.

Also they lose track - like Frigga said in the deleted scene - and if someone asks them what they did today they’re like: “well after breakfast I went pearl-diving and. Wait. No, that’s storyline IV, actually I talked to someone…was it father? I don’t know…” 

And the Revengers because I love them: Bruce who thinks that wow, Loki is an asshole but actually a good listener I’ve been talking for three hours and they never interrupt me. Except then he asks a question and either he doesn’t get an answer or it’s “No, the strawberries are fine.” and Thor who’s just walked in at Bruce waving his hand before Loki’s eyes for two seconds is like: “No chance that’s her chocolate-fondue face.” (For Valkyrie it’s the best state Loki can be in, because they don’t talk and she can just move them into some corner if they’re in the way and it’s fine)

And how often did the private frequency bleed into the public broadcast and Thor and Loki are sitting in some very boring very false history lesson with their tutor and in walks a very beautiful if imaginary horse? 

These are all important questions that I need answered.

title: dr strange doesn’t kill
body:
honestly i didn’t expect to like dr strange as much as i did. i didn’t even watch his solo movie until infinity war sold me on him but now that i have one thing that strikes me as really, really important is his refusal to kill and his horror when he is finally forced to kill. he views the hippocratic oath as sacred, he views human life as sacred and even though mordo and the ancient one try to take the wind out of sails soon enough i still find his views to be admirable.

after so many movies of the rest of the avengers just mowing down mooks after mooks or causing massive collateral damage, a hero actually acknowledges that these are real, human lives being lost

title: Nighty Night (Pt. 2)
body:
Title: Nighty Night 

Summary: The Avengers get a call about a college student with some unusual abilities. They recruit you to join the team. Too bad for them you’re a little crazier than they had anticipated. Drama ensues once you’re in the tower. 

Pairing: Youx??? 

Warning: Overall awkwardness and fangirling. 

https://whitewolframblings.tumblr.com/post/174835346035/nighty-night-part-1?is_liked_post=1

Part 2

After retrieving your belongings – a small, pink backpack and a heavy, leather jacket – from impound, the Avengers loaded you into a monstrous black Hummer driven by a giant of a man.

“To the tower, Happy,” Tony instructed the driver, closing the door of the vehicle.

“The tower?” you asked, turning to him as Happy navigated the streets of Manhattan. “You don’t mean –”

“Avengers Tower, that’s right,” Natasha smiled at you. “You’re with us now.”

“And since they probably won’t allow you back into the dorms,” Tony sighed, “I’ll phone ahead and have your things delivered tomorrow.”

You frowned at him disbelievingly. “You want me to live there?”

“Sure,” Tony said. “We’ve got plenty of room. It’s the best way for us to keep an eye on you. Besides, it’s not like you’ve got a choice after that stunt you pulled tonight.”

Steve pulled out his cellphone. “He is right. Something like that is bound to have certain consequences.” He began typing out a text. “I’ll let the others know to meet us in the common room.”

You turned your attention to your fingertips, a sense of excitement and uncertainty building within you. You were going to be an Avenger. Your life was going to change. Everything was going to change. Forever.

Natasha reached out and put her hand on your shoulder. “It’ll be fine,” she said reassuringly. “Don’t worry.”

The guards stationed in the lobby of the tower jumped up from their seats at the reception desk once they saw you. You paused behind the others, so that they could search you for weapons. Once they were finished, they gestured for you to go ahead.

“Sorry about that,” Tony smiled apologetically. “We’ll get you an ID badge. That way you don’t have to go through that whenever you want in or out.”

“We all have one,” Steve told you as you followed them into an all-glass elevator.

Your breath hitched in your throat as you spun around and the elevator began to climb. Below you, shimmering like thousands of stars were the glimmering lights of New York City. It was a sight you never got tired of, but you had never seen them quite like this before. “Wow,” you breathed out excitedly.

“Yeah,” Tony said, unable to hide his amusement at your reaction. “It’s definitely a better view than the one from the precinct.”

You couldn’t help but smile back at him, even if he was messing with you.  A moment later, the elevator doors opened and you followed them down a long hallway. You rounded a corner and found yourself standing in an enormous, round, sunken living room with a glass wall that gave you a panoramic view of the city. Sitting in the middle of the room on a collection of plush black sofas were most of the Avengers. Your heart sped up as your excitement began to give way to nervousness. You tried your best to swallow it, reminding yourself that they were just ordinary people.

“Guys,” Steve cleared his throat, drawing their attention to you. “This is Y/N Y/L/N. She’s our new recruit. She’s going to be staying here and training with us as of tonight.”

Right away, you felt your heart leap into into your throat as the others rose to approach you. This was it, you couldn’t help but think. You were here. Ordinary people, ordinary people, you chanted in your head like a mantra.

Your heart was pounding in your chest as a tall, grinning black man you recognized as Sam Wilson approached you closely followed by a handsome man with a long curtain of dark brown hair – James Buchanan Barnes. The man formerly known as The Winter Soldier. You had to bite your tongue to keep from grinning like an idiot.

“Hey, girl,” Sam greeted you. “I’m Sam. Welcome to the team.”

“Hey,” you said, shaking his hand. “Thank you.” Then, without thinking about it, you turned to Barnes and started to say, “Mr. Barnes –”

He cut you off, shaking his head. “Call me Bucky, please,” he couldn’t help but laugh at your apparent nervousness.

You immediately felt your face burn bright red. “Right,” you said. “Bucky, my psychology professor loves you.”

Bucky frowned at you. “Psychology?”

You nodded. “Yours is one of the most prominent cases of DID in the history of psychological science. A lot of people were convinced that multiple personalities were a myth until – well…” You trailed off, not wanting to bring up his traumatic history.

Why did you just say that? You immediately found yourself wondering as an awkward silence fell over the three of you. Any of that? It couldn’t possibly have been something that he liked to think about. God, you were an idiot.

“Y/N!” Natasha called out from the other side of the room. “Come say hi to Wanda and Vis.”

You smiled apologetically at Sam and Bucky before making your way across the room to where Natasha was. “Thank you,” you murmured to her gratefully under your breath. Then you turned to introduce yourself to the girl you recognized as the Scarlet Witch.

Steve and Tony stood back in the doorway, watching you interact with the others.

“It’s going well,” Steve observed with a smile.

“For now,” Tony sighed. “I have Friday running a background check on her now. Gotta make sure Y/N doesn’t have any skeletons in her closet if we’re gonna get the charges against her dropped.”

He and Steve looked up as they were approached by Doctor Bruce Banner and Peter Parker.

“So new girl, huh?” Bruce asked. “What’s her, uh, gift?”

“Some type of shadow manipulation,” Tony informed him. “She seems to be able to create constructs out of them, but we won’t know the depths of her capabilities until we see her in training.”

“I’ll spar with her,” Peter volunteered a little too eagerly.

Steve couldn’t help but smile at his enthusiasm, all too aware of where the teenager’s mind was. “I’m not sure I’d recommend it. Y/N doesn’t seem to have any qualms about fighting dirty.”

“He means she castrated a guy earlier this evening,” Tony clarified.

Bruce and Peter both stared at them, their smiles faltering.

“She w-what?” Peter asked, silently praying this disconcerting news about his newest teammate was, in fact, a joke.

“To be fair, the guy was a rapist,” Steve came to your defense.

“Yes, brother, but perhaps –”

All four of them looked up as Thor and his brother Loki entered the common room from the hallway that led to the kitchen. They appeared to be deep in conversation, but fell silent once they noticed the others.

“Oh, my god!”

Tony and Steve turned their attention back to you as a high-pitched squeal sounded across the room. You were staring awestruck at the two Asgardians, all traces of your previous nervousness seemingly vanished. Then, at Natasha’s gentle nudging, you launched yourself at the two brothers, giggling like an over-excited schoolgirl.

“Well, I guess we found out who her favorite Avenger is,” Steve commented, smiling.

“Point Break’s always had a pretty strong fanbase,” Tony said.

Then their smiles faded as they watched you fling yourself at Loki so unexpectedly that he stumbled over backwards, spilling tea all over the both of you. Thor stared at the two of you in shocked amusement while Loki looked as though he were struggling to decide whether or not he should slap the strange mortal who dared to lay hands on him. Without permission.

“Uh, shouldn’t someone –?” Bruce said, his voice trailing off in searching of the right words.

Without a moment’s hesitation, Tony grabbed Peter by the arm and began to steer him in your direction. “C’mon, Pete, let’s go say hi.”

Meanwhile, you were practically sitting in Loki’s lap, unable to stop yourself from babbling on and on, seemingly to oblivious to the sopping wet tea that was dribbling down the front of your jacket. “Oh,” you said excitedly, reaching into your bag to look for your cell phone. “And my friend, Mia, she named her cat after you–”

“As much as I appreciate your devotion,” the God of Mischief growled, cutting you off. “Would you kindly get off?!” He pushed you away from him with such force that you fell over onto the sofa behind you.

You brushed it off, giggling, too excited at having met him to actually think straight.

“Brother!” Thor scolded him. “This is no way to treat your admirers.” He pushed past Loki and knelt in front of you. “You must forgive my brother, fair lady, as he is yet unaccustomed to your Midgardian culture.”

You shook your head, starting to say that it was your own fault. Before you could respond, though, Tony appeared at your side, dragging along with him a boy who looked like he was barely old enough to be out of high school. You turned to the two of them smiling.

“Y/N, this is Peter,” Tony said, gesturing to the boy who looked deeply uncomfortable to be in your presence. “Peter Parker – AKA Spiderman. He’s starting classes at NYU next semester.”

“Nice to meet you, Peter,” you said, somewhat breathless from your encounter with Loki.

“Please, don’t castrate me,” Peter said, unable to keep a pleading tone out of his voice.

You couldn’t help but laugh as Thor and his brother now exchanged concerned looks in the background. “Don’t worry,” you assured Peter. “I’m not allowed to do that anymore. Tony made me promise.”

“Oh,” Peter said, looking immensely relieved. “Oh, thank god. I - I mean, Steve did say that guy was a rapist. So I guess he kinda deserved it, right?”

“Totally,” you said, nodding.

“So,” Tony said, changing the subject quickly. “I see you’re quite the fan of reindeer games here.”

At hearing mention of his nickname, Loki perked up and said, “Yes, just who is this mortal, Stark – I was not aware that we were simply letting people in off the street.”

“Oh, I’m Y/N,” you said, gesturing to yourself. “Tony, Steve, and Natasha convinced me to join the Avengers.”

Tony nodded. “That’s right, and she’ll be staying here, so try to play nice, okay?”

“Oh, and sorry I tackled you,” you added hastily. “It won’t happen again.”

“I should hope not,” Loki sneered at you.

“So tell me, Y/N,” Thor said, grinning broadly. “What is it about my younger brother that draws you to him?”

You felt your cheeks redden at the comment, and you turned your attention to your shoes as you spoke. “I just think it’s really cool how he single-handedly proved the existence of aliens.”

There was a moment of silence as the others processed what you had just said.

“You mean when he led the Chitauri attack on New York?” Peter asked finally, uncertain of whether or not he wanted to hear the answer.

“Yep,” you said, nodding.

“Y/N,” Tony said, now looking more than a little concerned. “We try not to reward or encourage violent alien invasions.”

“Oh, of course not,” you said quickly. “Benevolent contact is always preferred. It’s just so cool that now there’s actual, undeniable proof. I mean, hardly anyone had even heard of the Destroyer debacle in New Mexico, but there’s no writing off a full-scale invasion. Plus, the existence of Asgardians basically confirms Erich von Daniken’s ancient astronaut theory –”

“You know what, Y/N?” Tony said, cutting you off. “Why don’t I show you to your room?”

He pulled away from the others and led you back down the hallway to the elevator.

“She scares me,” Peter said, watching the two of you go.

A/N: Alright, guys, sorry if this chapter was a little short. I will try to make the next one longer. Honestly, I feel like this character is snowballing from awkward to straight-up insane. Who knows what the next chapter will bring. Lol. Please, like, reblog, and submit feed back. Thank you. 

Taglist

@misadventurous-meridian

You tried your best to swallow it, reminding yourself that they were just ordinary people.

“Guys,” Steve cleared his throat, drawing their attention to you. “This is Y/N Y/L/N. She’s our new recruit. She’s going to be staying here and training with us as of tonight.”

Right away, you felt your heart leap into into your throat as the others rose to approach you. This was it, you couldn’t help but think. You were here. Ordinary people, ordinary people, you chanted in your head like a mantra.

Your heart was pounding in your chest as a tall, grinning black man you recognized as Sam Wilson approached you closely followed by a handsome man with a long curtain of dark brown hair – James Buchanan Barnes. The man formerly known as The Winter Soldier. You had to bite your tongue to keep from grinning like an idiot.

“Hey, girl,” Sam greeted you. “I’m Sam. Welcome to the team.”

“Hey,” you said, shaking his hand. “Thank you.” Then, without thinking about it, you turned to Barnes and started to say, “Mr. Barnes –”

He cut you off, shaking his head. “Call me Bucky, please,” he couldn’t help but laugh at your apparent nervousness.

You immediately felt your face burn bright red. “Right,” you said. “Bucky, my psychology professor loves you.”

Bucky frowned at you. “Psychology?”

You nodded. “Yours is one of the most prominent cases of DID in the history of psychological science. A lot of people were convinced that multiple personalities were a myth until – well…” You trailed off, not wanting to bring up his traumatic history.

Why did you just say that? You immediately found yourself wondering as an awkward silence fell over the three of you. Any of that? It couldn’t possibly have been something that he liked to think about. God, you were an idiot.

“Y/N!” Natasha called out from the other side of the room. “Come say hi to Wanda and Vis.”

You smiled apologetically at Sam and Bucky before making your way across the room to where Natasha was. “Thank you,” you murmured to her gratefully under your breath. Then you turned to introduce yourself to the girl you recognized as the Scarlet Witch.

Steve and Tony stood back in the doorway, watching you interact with the others.

“It’s going well,” Steve observed with a smile.

“For now,” Tony sighed. “I have Friday running a background check on her now. Gotta make sure Y/N doesn’t have any skeletons in her closet if we’re gonna get the charges against her dropped.”

He and Steve looked up as they were approached by Doctor Bruce Banner and Peter Parker.

“So new girl, huh?” Bruce asked. “What’s her, uh, gift?”

“Some type of shadow manipulation,” Tony informed him. “She seems to be able to create constructs out of them, but we won’t know the depths of her capabilities until we see her in training.”

“I’ll spar with her,” Peter volunteered a little too eagerly.

Steve couldn’t help but smile at his enthusiasm, all too aware of where the teenager’s mind was. “I’m not sure I’d recommend it. Y/N doesn’t seem to have any qualms about fighting dirty.”

“He means she castrated a guy earlier this evening,” Tony clarified.

Bruce and Peter both stared at them, their smiles faltering.

“She w-what?” Peter asked, silently praying this disconcerting news about his newest teammate was, in fact, a joke.

“To be fair, the guy was a rapist,” Steve came to your defense.

“Yes, brother, but perhaps –”

All four of them looked up as Thor and his brother Loki entered the common room from the hallway that led to the kitchen. They appeared to be deep in conversation, but fell silent once they noticed the others.

“Oh, my god!”

Tony and Steve turned their attention back to you as a high-pitched squeal sounded across the room. You were staring awestruck at the two Asgardians, all traces of your previous nervousness seemingly vanished. Then, at Natasha’s gentle nudging, you launched yourself at the two brothers, giggling like an over-excited schoolgirl.

“Well, I guess we found out who her favorite Avenger is,” Steve commented, smiling.

“Point Break’s always had a pretty strong fanbase,” Tony said.

Then their smiles faded as they watched you fling yourself at Loki so unexpectedly that he stumbled over backwards, spilling tea all over the both of you. Thor stared at the two of you in shocked amusement while Loki looked as though he were struggling to decide whether or not he should slap the strange mortal who dared to lay hands on him. Without permission.

“Uh, shouldn’t someone –?” Bruce said, his voice trailing off in searching of the right words.

Without a moment’s hesitation, Tony grabbed Peter by the arm and began to steer him in your direction. “C’mon, Pete, let’s go say hi.”

Meanwhile, you were practically sitting in Loki’s lap, unable to stop yourself from babbling on and on, seemingly to oblivious to the sopping wet tea that was dribbling down the front of your jacket. “Oh,” you said excitedly, reaching into your bag to look for your cell phone. “And my friend, Mia, she named her cat after you–”

“As much as I appreciate your devotion,” the God of Mischief growled, cutting you off. “Would you kindly get off?!” He pushed you away from him with such force that you fell over onto the sofa behind you.

You brushed it off, giggling, too excited at having met him to actually think straight.

“Brother!” Thor scolded him. “This is no way to treat your admirers.” He pushed past Loki and knelt in front of you. “You must forgive my brother, fair lady, as he is yet unaccustomed to your Midgardian culture.”

You shook your head, starting to say that it was your own fault. Before you could respond, though, Tony appeared at your side, dragging along with him a boy who looked like he was barely old enough to be out of high school. You turned to the two of them smiling.

“Y/N, this is Peter,” Tony said, gesturing to the boy who looked deeply uncomfortable to be in your presence. “Peter Parker – AKA Spiderman. He’s starting classes at NYU next semester.”

“Nice to meet you, Peter,” you said, somewhat breathless from your encounter with Loki.

“Please, don’t castrate me,” Peter said, unable to keep a pleading tone out of his voice.

You couldn’t help but laugh as Thor and his brother now exchanged concerned looks in the background. “Don’t worry,” you assured Peter. “I’m not allowed to do that anymore. Tony made me promise.”

“Oh,” Peter said, looking immensely relieved. “Oh, thank god. I - I mean, Steve did say that guy was a rapist. So I guess he kinda deserved it, right?”

“Totally,” you said, nodding.

“So,” Tony said, changing the subject quickly. “I see you’re quite the fan of reindeer games here.”

At hearing mention of his nickname, Loki perked up and said, “Yes, just who is this mortal, Stark – I was not aware that we were simply letting people in off the street.”

“Oh, I’m Y/N,” you said, gesturing to yourself. “Tony, Steve, and Natasha convinced me to join the Avengers.”

Tony nodded. “That’s right, and she’ll be staying here, so try to play nice, okay?”

“Oh, and sorry I tackled you,” you added hastily. “It won’t happen again.”

“I should hope not,” Loki sneered at you.

“So tell me, Y/N,” Thor said, grinning broadly. “What is it about my younger brother that draws you to him?”

You felt your cheeks redden at the comment, and you turned your attention to your shoes as you spoke. “I just think it’s really cool how he single-handedly proved the existence of aliens.”

There was a moment of silence as the others processed what you had just said.

“You mean when he led the Chitauri attack on New York?” Peter asked finally, uncertain of whether or not he wanted to hear the answer.

“Yep,” you said, nodding.

“Y/N,” Tony said, now looking more than a little concerned. “We try not to reward or encourage violent alien invasions.”

“Oh, of course not,” you said quickly. “Benevolent contact is always preferred. It’s just so cool that now there’s actual, undeniable proof. I mean, hardly anyone had even heard of the Destroyer debacle in New Mexico, but there’s no writing off a full-scale invasion. Plus, the existence of Asgardians basically confirms Erich von Daniken’s ancient astronaut theory –”

“You know what, Y/N?” Tony said, cutting you off. “Why don’t I show you to your room?”

He pulled away from the others and led you back down the hallway to the elevator.

“She scares me,” Peter said, watching the two of you go.

A/N: Alright, guys, sorry if this chapter was a little short. I will try to make the next one longer. Honestly, I feel like this character is snowballing from awkward to straight-up insane. Who knows what the next chapter will bring. Lol. Please, like, reblog, and submit feed back. Thank you.

Title: Nighty Night 

Summary: The Avengers get a call about a college student with some unusual abilities. They recruit you to join the team. Too bad for them you’re a little crazier than they had anticipated. Drama ensues once you’re in the tower. 

Pairing: Youx??? 

Warning: Overall awkwardness and fangirling.

“And since they probably won’t allow you back into the dorms,” Tony sighed, “I’ll phone ahead and have your things delivered tomorrow.”

You frowned at him disbelievingly. “You want me to live there?”

“Sure,” Tony said. “We’ve got plenty of room. It’s the best way for us to keep an eye on you. Besides, it’s not like you’ve got a choice after that stunt you pulled tonight.”

Steve pulled out his cellphone. “He is right. Something like that is bound to have certain consequences.” He began typing out a text. “I’ll let the others know to meet us in the common room.”

Natasha reached out and put her hand on your shoulder. “It’ll be fine,” she said reassuringly. “Don’t worry.”

“We all have one,” Steve told you as you followed them into an all-glass elevator.
